trans-unit.source: Each device has associated DeviceInformation properties that you can use when you need specific information or when you are building a device selector.
trans-unit.target: Each device has associated DeviceInformation properties that you can use when you need specific information or when you are building a device selector.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Each device has associated [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) properties that you can use when you need specific information or when you are building a device selector.
trans-unit.target: Each device has associated [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) properties that you can use when you need specific information or when you are building a device selector.

trans-unit.source: These properties can be specified an AQS filter to limit the devices that you are enumerating over in order to find the devices with the specified traits.
trans-unit.target: These properties can be specified an AQS filter to limit the devices that you are enumerating over in order to find the devices with the specified traits.

trans-unit.source: You can also use these properties to indicate what information you want returned for each device.
trans-unit.target: You can also use these properties to indicate what information you want returned for each device.

trans-unit.source: That enables you to specify the device information that is returned to your application.
trans-unit.target: That enables you to specify the device information that is returned to your application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) properties in your device selector, see [Build a device selector](build-a-device-selector.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) properties in your device selector, see [Build a device selector](build-a-device-selector.md).

trans-unit.source: This topic goes into how to request information properties and also lists some common properties and their purpose.
trans-unit.target: This topic goes into how to request information properties and also lists some common properties and their purpose.

trans-unit.source: A [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) object is composed of an identity ([**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id)), a kind ([**DeviceInformation.Kind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.kind.aspx)), and a property bag ([**DeviceInformation.Properties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.properties.aspx)).
trans-unit.target: A [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) object is composed of an identity ([**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id)), a kind ([**DeviceInformation.Kind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.kind.aspx)), and a property bag ([**DeviceInformation.Properties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.properties.aspx)).

trans-unit.source: All of the other properties of a **DeviceInformation** object are derived from the **Properties** property bag.
trans-unit.target: All of the other properties of a **DeviceInformation** object are derived from the **Properties** property bag.

trans-unit.source: This means that the property bag always contains the information necessary to determine the other properties.
trans-unit.target: This means that the property bag always contains the information necessary to determine the other properties.

trans-unit.source: A [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) object has some basic properties, such as [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id) and [**Kind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.kind.aspx), but most of the properties are stored in a property bag under [**Properties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.properties.aspx).
trans-unit.target: A [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) object has some basic properties, such as [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id) and [**Kind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.kind.aspx), but most of the properties are stored in a property bag under [**Properties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.properties.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Because of this, the property bag contains the properties used to source the properties out of the property bag.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, the property bag contains the properties used to source the properties out of the property bag.

trans-unit.source: For example, use [System.ItemNameDisplay](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Bb760770) to source the [**Name**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.name) property.
trans-unit.target: For example, use [System.ItemNameDisplay](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Bb760770) to source the [**Name**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.name) property.

trans-unit.source: This is a case of a common and well-known property that has a user-friendly name.
trans-unit.target: This is a case of a common and well-known property that has a user-friendly name.

trans-unit.source: Windows provides several of these user-friendly names to make querying for properties easier.
trans-unit.target: Windows provides several of these user-friendly names to make querying for properties easier.

trans-unit.source: When you are requesting properties, you are not limited to the common properties with user-friendly names.
trans-unit.target: When you are requesting properties, you are not limited to the common properties with user-friendly names.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the underlying GUID and property ID (PID) to request any property that is available, even custom properties that are supplied by an individual device or driver.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the underlying GUID and property ID (PID) to request any property that is available, even custom properties that are supplied by an individual device or driver.

trans-unit.source: The format for specifying a custom property is "`{GUID} PID`".
trans-unit.target: The format for specifying a custom property is "`{GUID} PID`".

trans-unit.source: Some properties are common across all [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393kind) objects, but most are unique to a specific kind.
trans-unit.target: Some properties are common across all [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393kind) objects, but most are unique to a specific kind.

trans-unit.source: The following sections list some common properties sorted by the individual **DeviceInformationKind**.
trans-unit.target: The following sections list some common properties sorted by the individual **DeviceInformationKind**.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how the different kinds relate to one another, see **DeviceInformationKind**.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how the different kinds relate to one another, see **DeviceInformationKind**.

trans-unit.source: **DeviceInterface** is the default and most common [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393kind) object used in app scenarios.
trans-unit.target: **DeviceInterface** is the default and most common [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393kind) object used in app scenarios.

trans-unit.source: This is the kind of object that you should use unless the device API indicates a different specific **DeviceInformationKind**.
trans-unit.target: This is the kind of object that you should use unless the device API indicates a different specific **DeviceInformationKind**.

trans-unit.source: Identity of the **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** that contains the **Device** containing this **DeviceInterface**.
trans-unit.target: Identity of the **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** that contains the **Device** containing this **DeviceInterface**.

trans-unit.source: You can pass this value to [**CreateFromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.createfromidasync) along with **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** to find the appropriate container.
trans-unit.target: You can pass this value to [**CreateFromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.createfromidasync) along with **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** to find the appropriate container.

trans-unit.source: The interface class GUID this interface represents.
trans-unit.target: The interface class GUID this interface represents.

trans-unit.source: You can pass this value to [**CreateFromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.createfromidasync) along with **DeviceInformationKind.Device** to find the appropriate device.
trans-unit.target: You can pass this value to [**CreateFromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.createfromidasync) along with **DeviceInformationKind.Device** to find the appropriate device.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the interface is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the interface is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether this is the default device for the **System.Devices.InterfaceClassGuid**.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether this is the default device for the **System.Devices.InterfaceClassGuid**.

trans-unit.source: This is mainly used for printers.
trans-unit.target: This is mainly used for printers.

trans-unit.source: This does not work for audio since there are multiple audio defaults.
trans-unit.target: This does not work for audio since there are multiple audio defaults.

trans-unit.source: Use [**GetDefaultAudioRenderId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226819) or [**GetDefaultAudioCaptureId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226818) to get audio defaults.
trans-unit.target: Use [**GetDefaultAudioRenderId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226819) or [**GetDefaultAudioCaptureId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226818) to get audio defaults.

trans-unit.source: The best display name for the device object.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for the device object.

trans-unit.source: Device class used during device installation.
trans-unit.target: Device class used during device installation.

trans-unit.source: The compatible ids of the device.
trans-unit.target: The compatible ids of the device.

trans-unit.source: These are used when Windows is determining the best driver to install on the device.
trans-unit.target: These are used when Windows is determining the best driver to install on the device.

trans-unit.source: Identity of the **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** that includes this device.
trans-unit.target: Identity of the **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** that includes this device.

trans-unit.source: You can pass this value to [**CreateFromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.createfromidasync) along with **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** to find the appropriate container.
trans-unit.target: You can pass this value to [**CreateFromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.createfromidasync) along with **DeviceInformationKind.DeviceContainer** to find the appropriate container.

trans-unit.source: A bitwise-OR of the CM\_DEVCAP\_X capabilities flags that are defined in **CfgMgr32.h**.
trans-unit.target: A bitwise-OR of the CM\_DEVCAP\_X capabilities flags that are defined in **CfgMgr32.h**.

trans-unit.source: The device currently has a problem and is likely not functioning correctly.
trans-unit.target: The device currently has a problem and is likely not functioning correctly.

trans-unit.source: This could be due to an outdated, missing, or invalid driver.
trans-unit.target: This could be due to an outdated, missing, or invalid driver.

trans-unit.source: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id).
trans-unit.target: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id).

trans-unit.source: The hardware ids of the device.
trans-unit.target: The hardware ids of the device.

trans-unit.source: Windows uses these ids when determining the best driver to install.
trans-unit.target: Windows uses these ids when determining the best driver to install.

trans-unit.source: Device vendors can use this property to identify their device from their app.
trans-unit.target: Device vendors can use this property to identify their device from their app.

trans-unit.source: This is the connection parent, not the **DeviceContainer** parent.
trans-unit.target: This is the connection parent, not the **DeviceContainer** parent.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the device is currently present and available.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the device is currently present and available.

trans-unit.source: The best display name for this device object.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for this device object.

trans-unit.source: In this case, this is not necessarily the best name for users.
trans-unit.target: In this case, this is not necessarily the best name for users.

trans-unit.source: A more likely candidate for a user-friendly name could be found by referencing the **System.ItemNameDisplay** of the associated **DeviceContainer** or **DeviceInterface**.
trans-unit.target: A more likely candidate for a user-friendly name could be found by referencing the **System.ItemNameDisplay** of the associated **DeviceContainer** or **DeviceInterface**.

trans-unit.source: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.
trans-unit.target: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.

trans-unit.source: This list is provided as singular categories.
trans-unit.target: This list is provided as singular categories.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of categories this device belongs to.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of categories this device belongs to.

trans-unit.source: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.
trans-unit.target: A list of descriptions of the categories the device belongs to.

trans-unit.source: This list is provided as plural categories.
trans-unit.target: This list is provided as plural categories.

trans-unit.source: The collection of compatible ids for all the child **DeviceInformationKind.Device** objects.
trans-unit.target: The collection of compatible ids for all the child **DeviceInformationKind.Device** objects.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the device is currently connected to the system or not.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the device is currently connected to the system or not.

trans-unit.source: The collection of hardware ids for all the child **DeviceInformationKind.Device** objects.
trans-unit.target: The collection of hardware ids for all the child **DeviceInformationKind.Device** objects.

trans-unit.source: **True** if this **DeviceContainer** represents the system itself, **false** if the device is external to the system.
trans-unit.target: **True** if this **DeviceContainer** represents the system itself, **false** if the device is external to the system.

trans-unit.source: Model name of the device container.
trans-unit.target: Model name of the device container.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether any of the child **DeviceInformationKind.Device** objects are wireless or network devices that are currently paired with the system.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether any of the child **DeviceInformationKind.Device** objects are wireless or network devices that are currently paired with the system.

trans-unit.source: The best display name for this device.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for this device.

trans-unit.source: The best display name for this device.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for this device.

trans-unit.source: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id).
trans-unit.target: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id).

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the device can be paired with the system or not.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the device can be paired with the system or not.

trans-unit.source: The categories that the device is part of.
trans-unit.target: The categories that the device is part of.

trans-unit.source: The id of the parent **AssociationEndpointContainer** object.
trans-unit.target: The id of the parent **AssociationEndpointContainer** object.

trans-unit.source: If the device is a network device, this is the IP address.
trans-unit.target: If the device is a network device, this is the IP address.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the device is currently connected to the system.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the device is currently connected to the system.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the device is currently paired.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the device is currently paired.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the device is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the device is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.

trans-unit.source: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.
trans-unit.target: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.

trans-unit.source: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for **AssociationEndpoint** objects.
trans-unit.target: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for **AssociationEndpoint** objects.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.

trans-unit.source: That is why this property is important.
trans-unit.target: That is why this property is important.

trans-unit.source: The model id of the device.
trans-unit.target: The model id of the device.

trans-unit.source: The model name of the device.
trans-unit.target: The model name of the device.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the protocol used to discover this **AssocationEndpoint** device.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the protocol used to discover this **AssocationEndpoint** device.

trans-unit.source: The signal strength of the device.
trans-unit.target: The signal strength of the device.

trans-unit.source: This property is only applicable for some protocols.
trans-unit.target: This property is only applicable for some protocols.

trans-unit.source: The best display name for the device.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for the device.

trans-unit.source: The categories that the device is part of.
trans-unit.target: The categories that the device is part of.

trans-unit.source: The collection of ids for the **AssocationEndpoint** objects that are part of this container.
trans-unit.target: The collection of ids for the **AssocationEndpoint** objects that are part of this container.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if one of the child **AssociationEndpoint** devices can be paired with the system or not.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if one of the child **AssociationEndpoint** devices can be paired with the system or not.

trans-unit.source: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id), but in GUID form.
trans-unit.target: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id), but in GUID form.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if one of the child **AssociationEndpoint** devices is currently paired.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if one of the child **AssociationEndpoint** devices is currently paired.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if one of the child **AssociationEndpoint** devices is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if one of the child **AssociationEndpoint** devices is currently present, meaning the device is live and discovered over the network or wireless protocol.

trans-unit.source: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.
trans-unit.target: Once a device has been paired with the system, the device is cached.

trans-unit.source: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for **AssociationEndpoint** objects.
trans-unit.target: After this, the device will be automatically discovered when querying for **AssociationEndpoint** objects.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, you cannot rely on just discovering the device with a query to indicate whether or not it is currently usable.

trans-unit.source: That is why this property is important.
trans-unit.target: That is why this property is important.

trans-unit.source: A list of model ids for the device.
trans-unit.target: A list of model ids for the device.

trans-unit.source: Each model is a GUID in string form.
trans-unit.target: Each model is a GUID in string form.

trans-unit.source: The model name of the device.
trans-unit.target: The model name of the device.

trans-unit.source: A list of protocol ids that have contributed to building this **AssociationEndpointContainer** object.
trans-unit.target: A list of protocol ids that have contributed to building this **AssociationEndpointContainer** object.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that an **AssociationEndpointContainer** device is created by collecting all **AssociationEndpoint** devices discovered over different protocols for the same physical device.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that an **AssociationEndpointContainer** device is created by collecting all **AssociationEndpoint** devices discovered over different protocols for the same physical device.

trans-unit.source: List of casting URI schemes supported by this device.
trans-unit.target: List of casting URI schemes supported by this device.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if this device supports audio casting.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if this device supports audio casting.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if this device supports image casting.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if this device supports image casting.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if this device supports video casting.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if this device supports video casting.

trans-unit.source: The best display name for the device.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for the device.

trans-unit.source: The identifier of the parent **AssociationEndpoint** object.
trans-unit.target: The identifier of the parent **AssociationEndpoint** object.

trans-unit.source: The identifier of the parent **AssociationEndpointContainer** object.
trans-unit.target: The identifier of the parent **AssociationEndpointContainer** object.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the parent **AssociationEndpoint** object is paired with the system.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the parent **AssociationEndpoint** object is paired with the system.

trans-unit.source: Identity of the protocol used to discover this device.
trans-unit.target: Identity of the protocol used to discover this device.

trans-unit.source: Iidentity of the service represented by this device.
trans-unit.target: Iidentity of the service represented by this device.

trans-unit.source: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id).
trans-unit.target: This is also the value of [**DeviceInformation.Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.enumeration.deviceinformation.id).

trans-unit.source: The best display name for the service.
trans-unit.target: The best display name for the service.
